website_summaries.verdict: Extra depth allows these gap organizers to hold a greater variety of items. A well constructed and versatile option that won't break the bank.
pros: Deep, pocket-like design has space for tall items like papers or folders as well as everyday essentials
Slides directly into gaps without protruding
Flexible walls fit any space between 0.5" and 1.6"
Comes with velcro strips to prevent shifting
cons: Can shift somewhat when seats are adjusted, but this is easily fixed by using the Velcro strips

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for our QX50! We’ve had so many drops of stuff between the seats. This will solve the drop problem and hold our smart phones and other devices. Also comes with a little strip of Velcro if you want to keep it from moving.
customer_reviews.author: Ray F.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for cars that automatically adjust your seats
customer_reviews.text: ::Product:: I like how you can place your small belongings in this product. Not only did it fill the gap between your seats but it was useful to hold your items like your phone or keys. I ended up returning the item because when I needed to move my seat, it would make a sound. I was worried it would scratch my side console and it actually did which I'm not happy about. Also, my car automatically adjust when I enter and leave the car, so I continuously heard the “sliding sound”. ::Installation:: Easy and straightforward. ::Delivery:: Arrived on time. The item was packaged in a plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: Luvblue28

customer_reviews.title: Great for some cars, perhaps will not work as well for larger vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: This works great in my '16 CRV. I had been using the 2nd cup holder for miscellaneous items, but then, one less cup holder for cups! Great for cell phone, pack of gum, wipe for the navigator screen, etc. I got one for a friend with a Toyota 4runner and it sinks a bit lower between the seat and console, so I'm not sure it will work as well in a larger vehicle. But I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE-GAME CHANGER!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS PRODUCT! No more mess of trying to jam everything into my car cups! No more accidently spilling a drink with my iphone right next to it! Everything from my shopping lists, kleenex, note pad with pen handy coins for parking meters and my iphone, ipod etc. are protected and in one convenient spot. Fits my Mercedes perefecty and looks like bought from dealership. Absolutely MUST if you take trips as it will collect maps, souvenirs, etc. that used to be scattered over car. And my super picky husband LOVES it also and he is a clean car fanatic. He is still gushing about it! Definitely will buy for Xmas stocking stuffers-EVERYONE NEEDS THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Muench

customer_reviews.title: Slipping “Pocket” is Worth the Trouble
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this product, especially since I can’t tell you how many times I’ve had to get out of the car and dig around for something that fell between the seats. A black interior makes it even worse. The only problem is that with multiple drivers, the seats are moved constantly and the pocket itself slips down. I don’t want to use the sticky tape in my car, so I’m just dealing with that. Still it is a lot easier (and doesn’t require my getting out of the car) to reach down and pull the pocket back up when it slips.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Alkire

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution!
customer_reviews.text: So far I like them! I haven’t dropped anything between the seat since installing. I like that they’re actual pockets that I can put small stuff in. They look nice, although I’m not a huge fan of the small chrome buttons and I wish they offered varied colors of stitching as I want white to match my seats. All in all they’re great! I didn’t have to use the Velcro as the space in my Q50S is very narrow. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: BLynch

customer_reviews.title: They Work.......For a Little While
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, and they’re heavy duty. The only complaint I have is that the sides compress over time and then they fall into the crack, WHICH IS WHAT I WAS TRYING TO PREVENT IN THE FIRST PLACE!!! A center divider made to match the contour of the sides of the product would probably help to retain its shape and hold it in place but it would somewhat limit its functionality. I plan on making a couple dividers because until I do they will remain forever lost in a black hole!
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Quality, design and function working in harmony!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Been using these for almost 2 weeks now. When they arrived, I was pleasantly surprised that they were a leather material and actually looked really great. Previous products I have seen were just solid gray/black plastic. The material is soft to the touch, so if me or my passengers reach down into one of my gap fillers it's incredibly comfortable! I just love the detail that was put into this design! These replaced some squishy, thick gap fillers that weren't pockets and just didn't stay between the seats for anything. So those weren't working for me. These gap fillers, however, are absolutely wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: R. Joy

customer_reviews.title: Works PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.text: Item fits perfectly on the passenger and driver sides of my 2015 Jeep Wrangler JKU. Didn't even need the adhesive to keep them in place. In fact, I can still move the seats forward and backwards without moving them. Already caught my phone 2x from accidentally sliding under the seat - and anyone who has a wrangler knows that means slipping under the rug fold and being a pain in the a** to get. Love these things!
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: They both fell through in between the seat and center console. I have a 2016 Honda Civic. I tried to adjust it and the hard plastic inside of it snapped. I'm pretty sure they are on the floor of my car, I'm between the seats still. Now I guess it works to catch stuff that drops? Nope I took them out of the car entirely. I wish I had time to return them but didn't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Neph

customer_reviews.title: Who knew?!! These are so helpful!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product! I just got home from a road trip and these pockets we're so helpful, motel keys, receipts, etc. I had purchased them for another reason... I don't like the space between the seats and consul -its difficult to reach and clean, items always fall between but these pockets solve that dilemma! Great idea! Would be helpful if there was a sticky strip or something to grip on to. Can't put heavier items since it'll slip down. Otherwise, I love them!
customer_reviews.author: 5boysand2dogs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Nissan Leaf w/ small tight space
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT! I have a small space in my Nissan Leaf. The seats get narrower in the back closer to the seat belt lock than the front, where it nearly touches the center console. It's an awkward space to fill, and even more awkward to fetch something dropped from. This fits the space well if not perfectly. Actually, absolutely nothing else would fit that space at all. The relief of not having to reach around under the very tight and small front seat is hard to quantify, but it's between happy and thrilled! The compartments are rather small of course, but it's made for a small tight space. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Old AliceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: They will not stay up between seats. Used adhesive and they still tend to fall. They spend more time under my cars seats then in between them. I would not recommend. I really really thought this was the answer to fallen keys and cell phone. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: that it looked like it was from the dealership
customer_reviews.text: Does what I want - prevents things from sliding down by my seat into the area I can't reach. I'm not using the velcro that came with it to secure it because the space is so narrow that I have to be able to pull it out to retrieve items or to discard the crumbs and trash that fall into it. Because I don't use the velcro, it has a tendency to slide around in the spot it's in, and that really is my only complaint. Someone asked if my car came with it, so I took that as a compliment, that it looked like it was from the dealership.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I needed this so bad!! As an outside sales rep for a National Truck Body builder, I literally spend more time in my car than anywhere else. I was always dropping stuff between the seats, crawling around looking for it. No more! These fit perfect, add extra storage, and not ONE SINGLE ITEM has fallen between the seats since I installed them. They just slide into place, and come with handy Velcro fasteners to secure them into place. These are great!!
customer_reviews.author: TBRSRFLORIDA

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for any of our vehicles, however quality is good and came on time
customer_reviews.text: The pockets don't work for our two cars or truck. We have some gap fillers we use in one car that have a narrow base that opens to a small catchall on top. These legobner gap fillers are envelopes that slide down to the base of the seat and only catch items that fall between the seat and console but aren't really useful to hold a phone or sunglasses as you buckle up or put your drink in the drink holder, or keep spare change easily accessible. They are well made, came on time and are exactly as described - just not what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: SLW

customer_reviews.title: It is not wide enough in a Prius
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered timely by the seller in perfect condition so the seller would get a 5 star. The product itself is sturdy but is useless for holding anything other than a few pieces of mail or a phone. I guess it will stop items from falling in between the seats but useless for a long trip. It comes with Velcro but I’m not going to stick anything to the console. I’ll rig up something for the trip to keep it secured in place and maybe actually have the ability to hold more items. Even if there were more spacing between seats the item does not have much more expansion capability, oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a finished product yet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a potentially good space saving product but lacks any adjustable depth. Therefore, it just sinks down to the floor. Worse, it tilts to the heaviest end which insures your items are on the rear floor or heaven forbid under your brake pedals. The wedges that are pictured did not arrive with my purchase, instead they sent to strips of velcro. As if I would velcro this to my console and risk tearing the thin covering on most consoles....no thanks!
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: Handy little pockets!
customer_reviews.text: Fit just right in my Honda CR-V. Of course they don't hold a lot because the gap by my seats are not very big but I didn't expect them too. I mainly got them to keep stuff from falling between the cracks. They work great for junk mail, phone, etc. Edited from 5 star to 4 because they won't stay in place. We used the Velcro and they still come loose and slide down. Now I reach down to get the pocket and I get sticky residue from the Velcro on my hands. Still they do keep items from slipping to the floor and under the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hill

customer_reviews.title: Loved them at first but not so much anymore
customer_reviews.text: Loved the ease and functionality of them at first. Still usable, but they're not as stiff anymore and shift around too much and stuff falls out, or behind it defeating the purpose. If you have chairs that move forward and backward upon entering/exiting the vehicle I would could not recommend these. I'm thinking if you don't ever move them they might be better, but still not as great as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: shopping24-7

customer_reviews.title: good quality item
customer_reviews.text: tried it in Subaru crosstrek and Honda Fit. It did fit the Crosstrek but isn't very usefull. Got a CD into it but it was sticking out of top as this product is NOT very deep. It did not fit the Honda Fit at all-not enough room between seat and console. I did not find this item useful. My daughter took them for her Mazda. Hopes they will keep things from falling down into that space-like coins, keys, etc but not for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Had these in my car for a few weeks and forgot they were there. The fit was fine and I imagine they would fit most vehicles. Yesterday I realized the adhesive on the back of the Velcro had melted and I had to retrieve the driver side pouch from the depths of the crevice between the seat and console. Now I have adhesive residual on the side of the console. I’m getting rid of these because the product doesn’t offer any practical storage because they flatten when seat is occupied. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Big Kid At Heart

customer_reviews.title: I knew I needed this, just not as much as I do
customer_reviews.text: Of course I was aggravated that things kept dropping between the seat and the console of my car, especially keys and charger cord cord ends. The gap filler works perfectly to solve that problem. What I didn’t anticipate was how easy it was to corral different papers that I collected during the day, bring it inside, then return it. It is sort of a holding spot for all those miscellaneous things that never seem to have a home in the car. No more searching for that rental car agreement or airplane itinerary. Thank you for making life just a little bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Big Deal!  Well made, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 2019 Kia Sportster. Fits between the seat and console but really isn't much good for anything except some papers and stuff like that that. I had hoped to keep my phone and clip on sunglasses in it but neither one works (phone does not fit and clip ons fell to the bottom and were very difficult to get out. If this thing had some pockets it might be better but it is just one fairly large sack. It is well made but still pretty useless in a smaller SUV.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hiemenz

customer_reviews.title: Extra pockets? These are perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great extra pockets. Holds iPhone, wallet, keys, anything that fits getween the seats and console, Great for door and the pocket on back of seat. Love buying things that are exactly as presented. The material is nice as well. There is a sectioned pocket for iPhone to keep it secure and easy to reach! Recommend without caution as it is perfect for my Forester, and me.
customer_reviews.author: HLT

customer_reviews.title: just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I own a Mazda Miata, which is understandably short on storage space in the cab. With Covid, I have several extra things to pack with me every time I go out: Wipes, masks, gloves. These items are flexible and will compact well. The storage containers are appropriate for these items, and helps me maintain a cleaner cab. The storage sleeves probably wouldn't work well for water bottles, sunscreen, etc. But, I'm glad I have them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Catches Crumbs and Dropped Phones
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. I bought something similar years ago, but it was less substantial. It caught dropped items, even a spilled drink, but it kept slipping toward the floor and didn't last long. This one installed easily and is a thicker product, so I believe it will hold its place well. In only a week, it caught a dropped cell phone, some change and a few crumbs from a drive-thru breakfast. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tilda

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job filling in the void between seat and center console.
customer_reviews.text: These are handy for providing a space where small items, and particularly cell phones, can fall and not end up in the cracks or below the car seats. Color is a light gray, which works well with my very light beige interior. Easy to install and pliable enough to provide flexibility and “expand” to fill the void between the seat and the center console. However, does not provide a storage solution, if they was the intent. Great buy nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Stay in place to hold everything.
customer_reviews.text: Fill the gap in our Ford Explorer perfectly, preventing small items from falling beneath the seat while providing a safe and handy place for tablets, phones etc —a much better use of space than the pillows that only have a small slit to hold a phone. The Velcro tape to hold them onto the console works well to keep them at seat level instead of slipping too low to easily reach items inside. Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: MWA

customer_reviews.title: They fill the gap
customer_reviews.text: These gap fillers were perfect! I have a Toyota Highlander and there is not a lot of space between the seats and the console, but these fit perfectly. They don't slide around or fall down too low and they keep things from falling through and under the seats. They have space to hold my phone, keys, and reader. They are not meant for cups or anything large, but that' OK, because they are just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Queenie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I needed to stop everything from always falling between my seats and console. It was beyond aggravating. This solves that problem! My phone fits well, sunglasses fit also, There is plenty of room for other small loose items. I love that it was a 2 pack. I only wish it had some sort of velcro to stick it a little more flush to the side.. It still prevents things from falling they just dont necessarily fall in the slot.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but application somewhat fails
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Fantastic for blocking the chasms between the front seats of my 2019 subaru forester. However it doesn't quite stay still, sometimes sliding lower than I'd like, resulting in it compressing between the seats, which diminishes the storage capacity
customer_reviews.author: Denferns

customer_reviews.title: Not for automatic seats
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised they have a Porsche in the demo photos. I got a set for my Cayenne, since there really isn’t much space for anything. However, I would not recommend these for those who have cars with seats that are programmed to move personalized to the driver. I ended up giving these to my daughter who drives my old Sequoia, where EVERYTHING falls in the cracks. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Ashleyangel

customer_reviews.title: Stops things falling down under the car seat
customer_reviews.text: I used to get very frustrated when "things" would fall down between the car seat and the consul. So I bought this product. At first it kept on sliding down to the floor and would not catch things. I was frustrated it would not stay in place. But lately...and I have done nothing to make this happen...it is staying in place and my hand dos not need to get caught between the seat. I am glad I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Noraza

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2019 CR-V which doesn’t have a wide space but I knew that in advance of ordering this product. It fits nicely and stays secure without the strips however due to the small gap I can’t put much in it except for narrow stuff. It does fit my iPhone X though. I’m using it mainly to keep stuff from dropping between my seat. Would recommend this well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Waylandgal

customer_reviews.title: Ok but falls down the gap way too easily
customer_reviews.text: Well I have to say this ended up being pretty much exactly what I expected. Works ok and definitely fills the gap but even with the Velcro strips provided, it just slides down the crack way to often and too easily. I’ve noticed some of these come with foam pieces to cut to size so you can keep the width consistent, I may try one of those. This works for now.
customer_reviews.author: Billy C

customer_reviews.title: Serves my purpose, but just okay
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my phone always seems to fall down into the depths of the Mariana trench (aka under the car seat where it is impossible to retrieve). In reality, it works for that. When I drop my phone, it can only go so far. But I don't think it would be good for any other application. The pocket sits too low and has a very narrow opening (I use it in a Toyota 4-Runner). If you were to store other things in it, they would be hard to get out.
customer_reviews.author: K Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: They may not store a great deal of things, but I use them to hold my cell phone and my mask and a few other odds and ends, and they're perfect for that. I didn't even really need to use the velcro to fix them in place, because my seat gap is narrow, so these were perfect. They move a little sometimes when the seat gets adjusted, but not much. The grey ones matched my Hyundai Elantra grey interior very well. The quality of the material is nice.
customer_reviews.author: MSG4ME

customer_reviews.title: Not liking them. Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: They’re very stiff; I have to move them forward to snap my seatbelt. My husband doesn’t like them. They don’t fit very well in my car. 2007 Lexus. I bought them to stop my cell phone from falling between my seat and counsel but when I put my phone in the gap filler it falls in and it’s difficult to get it out because the material is so stiff. The passenger side one is great. I use it for trash
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Will slide down if you adjust your seat.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, but every time the car seats are adjusted (my husband and I both like driving this car), the gap filler drops down. You have to manually move it each time. It is pretty annoying. I drive a 2017 Dodge Challenger. The gap isn't that big to begin with. I would expect this item to stay put when the seat is adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: firekracker

customer_reviews.title: A divider would have helped a lot
customer_reviews.text: The item is really nice: seems well-made and fits right into my car space. I would have given a 5 star but have discovered that things fall over into the carrier and then I forget them. More than once I have needed to return to my car to fish out an item that turned over in the filler and was lost to sight. It would have been much better if there had been a divider do that things wouldn’t fall over and disappear.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Strauss

customer_reviews.title: NOT JUST FOR CARS
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently went through a renovation which left us with 7 remotes for the bedroom. We have a split king bed and this fits between the split and holds the remotes. I have stopped crawling under the bed to find them. I could not be happier with my purchase. I do use the other one, as it came as a set of 2, in my car. I am no longer trying to reach my keys, credit cards, sunglasses etc from between the seats. It's a win win purchase for us.
customer_reviews.author: karen e. mortenson

customer_reviews.title: No more lost items!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about how great these are! Not only are they stylish for any brand vehicle, they were super easy to insert (we didn't need to use the velcro strips that came with them). But the best part is they absolutely prevent anything from falling between the seat and the middle console. No more lost keys, pens, coins, or phones. In fact, it creates the perfect storage for your phone while driving if you don't have a designated space. Highly recommend these if you are considering purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job Well
customer_reviews.text: They do exactly as advertised! I constantly have things slide between my seat and my console, but now these catch those items. They also work great to store things I don’t necessarily want inside the console.
customer_reviews.author: Malissa C. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor adhesive material
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t too difficult to install but after being installed for a little over 6 months, the adhesive is all over and it’s a mess. There has to be a better way to keep it in place without turning into this. Bummer because it’s served it’s purpose well as far as catching things that fall into this area.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect in any way, but it gets the job done. I mainly bought this because I want somewhere to put my cell phone while I drive. The best part is how good they look - very professional, definitely a car upgrade. However, I don't like how stiff they are - the shape definitely is not perfect for all car sizes/models. It's just wedged between my seat and cup holders.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstie Porter

customer_reviews.title: Solid product. Too many expect too much.
customer_reviews.text: It's quality construction. The length is good but I have a Mini Cooper. The driver side could benefit from a shorter length, but only if you want it to ride high. If you slide it deep between the seat and center console it's fine. It's definitely snug for my mini. people with trucks or SUV's may want something bigger. No one should expect these to lock in place without some effort on their side to secure them. Expectations of people.
customer_reviews.author: DangerMan

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: While they’re actually very narrow and can hold very little, they serve their purpose. I wanted to get something more practical and larger, but my car had such a slim space, that this was all they could fit. They’re pretty sturdy and don’t collapse completely. I only wish they were deeper and slightly wider.
customer_reviews.author: Tobi Flenderson

customer_reviews.title: Item is as described. Great addition to my Honda
customer_reviews.text: I installed these items in my 2020 Honda Accord and it fit SNUG and even when I adjusted my chairs it was adjusting along with it with no sound. I don’t even have the adhesive stickers on at all. It might drop a bit in the near future depending on what’s in it, but it’s too hot to put those stickers up there so I’ll wait and see what happens. For now, it’s the perfect product to make sure you keep the floor carpets crumb free or key free at that!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Genius idea!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Great design and color and fits perfectly between the seat and console of my vehicle. I really dont keep anything in there on a regular basis, but it serves its purpose by not allowing items to fall between the seat and console, which is the main reason I bought it. Frustration eliminated!
customer_reviews.author: N. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Not very deep or sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I had hoped or as deep as needed. I honestly could just drop a file folder down there and it would work better. May be because of my car, Dodge Journey, but they just get squeezed flat and I can't put anything in. Disappointed. I work out of my car and had hopes this would help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution. My new 2017 Toyota Sienna is poorly designed with a gap just big enough for things to slip down and small enough your hand doesn’t fit. I kept having to find creative ways to get my mail out of it. These have saved me. And I love that my cup holders can be used for my water bottle instead of my phone. Great idea and product! Btw I was worried I would struggle with the seatbelt because of this. But it hasn’t been a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my Phone from falling between the seats!
customer_reviews.text: I should have measured the distance between the seat and the console but didn't think it would fit without a problem. It's swedged in without the double sticky sided take that was enclosed but really can't put anything in the pocket. I have a 2002 Toyota Camry. I gave the product 5 stars because it's a worthy and useful product to purchase, I just failed to measure (as is indicated in their product before buying) the space between the side of the seat and the middle console.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Customer

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I took so long to send this review,but so far we love it. We were constantly dropping things down the side of the seats and just one day I said enough and went right in the house and placed the order. I am really glad we did. I thought we might have trouble with it when we adjusted the seats, but no it was fine. Thank you for making such a great product. Wish I could afford to buy each of my kids these, for all the times they have dropped their phones down the side of the seat..haha. Again thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: John F Boyer

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: anything and everything dropped between seats and console. not an easy place to go digging for lost items. bought these for both seats. fit is tight, but nothing drops down there anymore. can hold a few things to keep near by, but not great for extra storage. Ok with me, just wanted to stop stuff from going between seats and console.
customer_reviews.author: jbtrubiano

customer_reviews.title: Works on a Jeep Wrangler JK
customer_reviews.text: As anyone who takes their Jeep off-road, with a phone on a dash mount knows, the phone will inevitably escape and make its way into the black hole that is the floor between the console and the seat rail - that special place where you can't get at it. I got the gap filler not so much to store stuff, but to intercept the flying phone. For that purpose, this product will work just fine. I may even use it to store stuff some day.
customer_reviews.author: Arno E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Gap fillers with dual purpose.
customer_reviews.text: In our 2015 CRV there was not a lot of space for the pockets initially. We raised them about an inch and a half higher than the console so the pockets open wider. The enclosed Velcro keeps the pockets where we want them. They do not want nterfere with operating the car. These hold our pens, a little notebook and of course all the change and things that would have fallen through to the floor. The pockets arrived on time and are just as described. I would recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: K.M. Lake

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit well
customer_reviews.text: Tried them in my pickup, won't stay in place. Put them in my wife's ford escort, and they pinch shut so tight there is no room to put any thing in it. Would be much better to just cut a piece of foam rubber to match the gap in any vehicle and forget storage,
customer_reviews.author: texas shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to fill seat gaps in my ford escape. The gaps are small so these don't provide very much storage but do give me a place to stick my phone and extra keys to prevent them from disappearing into the black hole, (once lost keys in there and it took several hours and a flashlight to catch a glimpse of them). Because my gaps are small I have not had to use the velcro and the pockets seem to be staying in place just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G.

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a new Subaru and the space between the seat and console is wider than in my other car. I seem to drop something everyday so I was annoyed to say the least and decided to order these. They are a nice durable material, because of the shape and material they fit perfectly between both seats, (the space is slightly narrower on the passenger side) even when I move the driver seat forward since I am short, it did not fall thru. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: LMT

customer_reviews.title: Fills the Gap
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these about a week, but do have them in my vehicle. So far, I like them, if for nothing else to catch things that might fight between the seat. I haven't had them long enough to do a thorough review, so I will leave it at that and update as I need to. They don't take away from the aesthetics of the vehicle and I think will prove to be beneficial. This was not a planned by and sometimes those work out best.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Falls in the gap for a Nissan Murano
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and placed it in my 2011 Nissan Murano. Over time, the seat gap filler falls into the gap, so I had to put a bottle in the gap filler to keep the pressure open so that it wouldn't fall into the gap. Doesn't do what I wanted it to do for $17
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: good product, but..
customer_reviews.text: I always hated the " Black hole between my seats in my Toyota Rav-4 plus any other car I have had with bucket seats. I ordered 2 dividers and your product does it's job and its matches the interior of my vehicle perfectly. But the adhesive tapes that holds the divides in their place are not very strong. If you could please sent me some more that would be great. it is very cold here in Massachusetts. and maybe that's why the strips are not holding so well Thanks! Beth Abbondandolo 55 ida Avenue Brockton MA 02302
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Abbondandolo

customer_reviews.title: Great compact size
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 2008 HHR to free up space on console. HHR has very limited between seat storage capacity and these seem to fit well between the seat and console. Haven't found a need for the adhesive velcro strips as they are pretty snug for my application.
customer_reviews.author: M. MCINTOSH

customer_reviews.title: lebogner 2 Pack Car Seat Gap Filler
customer_reviews.text: WOWWWWW just received my order and my lebogner 2 Pack Car Seat Gap Filler fits perfectly inside my car it’s leather and totally match my car interior. I loved it!! I been looking for this for a long time it’s perfect for what I’m looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Huynh Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Keep small essentials close at hand
customer_reviews.text: These gap filler pockets are well-constructed and have an unobtrusive appearance. They're a bit of a tight fit in my Nissan Maxima, but that's ok. I keep cough drops and a small pack of Kleenex in the one next to the passenger seat, and my cell and small change in the pocket next to the driver's seat. I'd recommend these pockets to anyone looking for a way to keep small essentials close at hand.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernbelleV

customer_reviews.title: Product Excellence
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. I ordered one for my 2017 Honda Civic Sedan and I ordered a set for my niece's Lexus. Perfect fit, right color and I believe they are going to be just fine for what we need I have recommended these to three of my relatives and a friend. hopefully they will be ordering soon. They fit perfectly in my niece's Lexus.. Mine are already in my new Honda. Fit great.....
customer_reviews.author: Deanie

customer_reviews.title: I think it can fit one envelope and a pen....and a Galaxy S10e
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from this. Edited 5 minutes after I wrote my original review, quote from the recipient of this gift, my boyfriend: “To be fair, It caught my phone once.”
customer_reviews.author: Moonlitfirefly

customer_reviews.title: Decent value.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice in terms of quality. The adhesive strips held them in place for about one day. Nonetheless, they come in handy and don’t take up any seat space. I made a hole in one to enable me to slip a phone charging cord thru it. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Due to tightness I won't be able to store larger items like cellphones or remotes with easy access
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered promptly and on time. Product well made, seems very durable. Gaps in my seats are a bit tight but this product has already captured a fallen lighter. Due to tightness I won't be able to store larger items like cellphones or remotes with easy access, but it will store these items and more. Currently only using them for back up phone cords and napkins, pens, and gum, creating space in my center console storage for other items. I'd buy them again...wish I had them on my old truck!
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for our 2018 Explorer. Could not get it to stay in place. The sticky tape would not hold and came off each time the seat moved forward and back. I eventually ordered a Drop Stop which worked great. It is a much better design because it fits over the seat belt and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Howie and/or Cyndy

customer_reviews.title: A good product!
customer_reviews.text: A popular gift this year! This quality leather pocket has sturdy walls but is bendable enough to slide into the space next to the console. No adhesive was needed. Perfect for holding envelopes, change, some sunglasses. Just started using it yesterday and nothing fell down between the seats!
customer_reviews.author: M. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Does keep things from falling between seat
customer_reviews.text: A good unit to stop anything from falling between seats. Only downfall is it squeezes unit together so you can’t put hardly anything in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally got these
customer_reviews.text: So glad I finally bought this. I've had this item in my wish list for a few months but finally purchased after my phone slipped between the driver's seat/center console again. No more frustrations and having to get into yoga poses to try to retrieve it. The leather is nice and I didn't even need to is the Velcro strips to keep them in place. What's also nice is you can slip more important items in these without worrying about someone seeing them easily from outside. Super convenient and affordable. Wish I bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Namshee

customer_reviews.title: convenient, high quality seat gap filler
customer_reviews.text: So easy - just slide in the gap between the seat and the console. In our car there was not much space in there, but these squeezed in, they just aren't the full width open. Great to catch falling objects, and big enough to stick phone and other items in. They seem of high quality, not cheap looking. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: OctoberLady

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to worry
customer_reviews.text: This does what it is suppose to do. The two were impossible to separate so the two fit OK and am using them this way. It is also nice to have the extra room to store items and of course don't have to worry about things falling that I can't easily reach of which it is mainly for.
customer_reviews.author: Donna .

customer_reviews.title: If you hate digging for items between your car seats, you need these.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I needed these in my life until I installed them. The gaps between the front seats and the center console of my Toyota Highlander have been dubbed the "black hole" where car keys, debit cards and phones require an elbow deep extraction. These organizers fit perfectly in the gap, I did not need to use included velcro anchors. They are perfectly sized for cell phone, papers/mail, etc; they prevent items from falling between the seats and they don't look out of place.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy M

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Snug fit in my 2020 Honda Pilot due to the small amount of space between seat & console. So no need to use adhesive. Even though space in my car is small, organizer adjusts nicely to it. I just use it for smaller things. I keep my phone, glasses, comb and chapstick in mine. If your car has a bigger space you will have more room to put bigger stuff in it. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Bout for a 2015 Audi. It barely fits on the side of the seat. The space is so narrow that it squeezes the filler almost closed. Can’t fit much other than a couple sheets of paper in it.
customer_reviews.author: AuNaturel1

customer_reviews.title: Best organizer car organizer
customer_reviews.text: This was an absolute gem to find!!! I love it! It fit perfectly in the small space between my seat and center console. I was pleasantly surprised that two came in the package!! My cell phone fits in there perfectly when my two cup holders are being used. My fiancé places his wallet in there as well. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis L.

customer_reviews.title: They keep slipping down.
customer_reviews.text: They are of very good quality. However they keep slipping down. I measured my car before purchase and they seemed to be just fine but after a few item i.e. Pens and handicap window card they began to slip down. I tried pushing them back and even though they feel right they still slip. I think I may try to keep them in place with Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: A. Klarich

customer_reviews.title: They fit
customer_reviews.text: Of course my main worry was that they would be too big to fit or too small and move around or slip into the seat gap themselves. They are much bigger than my seat gap but squeeze down easily to fill the whole gap and stay in place. Just what I was hoping for. I am the only one who drives my car wo I dont know how they do with moving the car seat but they came with velcro tape that I didnt need to use that i assume would help that.
customer_reviews.author: Hercules Q Rockefeller

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be deeper and longer, perhaps expandable
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be deeper and longer, even expandable. A nice addition to our Sienna vans, but not as good as it could or should be. A few things fit in the pockets which is nice, but it could be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun GourmetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: If you need a little more storage room for your car it will suffice.
customer_reviews.text: It was made well. I thought I would have more space for storage but I didn't because the closeness of my seat and the console. But it did helped with adding enough storage space for some of my essentials.
customer_reviews.author: Flatbush

customer_reviews.title: Tore when the car seat adjusted
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. When the car seat adjusted and moved back and forth the think tore. You would think it would be better quality but it’s pretty awful. Had it for a month and I can’t even return it because the window closed. I have to throw money in the trash now.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect place to stow my phone while charging and prevent losing things in the gap
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what I wanted it to. Keeps things from falling in the tiny gap. Great place to park my phone while it’s charging in the port in my dash. It fits great in my Buick La Cross. Didn’t need the adhesive strips. Does fine with my seat that automatically moves to my preferred settings when I start the car.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: This item didn't work for me. My seat slides back and forward when the car is started and stopped, so adhesion was not a good idea. It is so short that it does not stay up and falls down in between the seat and center console. Finally got tired of it and bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: agizzle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot. It does what it says. Its well made and looks good on the passenger side. My problem is that my legs are short so I have my seat all the way forward so the product is awkwardly placed so I will not be using it on the drivers side. My SO will be using it in their car. All in all, a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Luv2Sign99

customer_reviews.title: A less expensive great quality alternative to the “name brand” seat gap fillers
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to install in any vehicle, the vehicle I installed this product in has very small gaps so these slide in perfectly and act as a barrier to items trying to slip down the gap. But even with the very small gaps there is still plenty of room to hold a cell phone or any other number of slim items.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Moder

customer_reviews.title: Fits and adjusts well without the need of the velcro included.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the fillers were light but they're actually about 1 lb each - Pleather but heavy grade - not sure if these can survive 7-9 years in various temperatures and abuse but guess I'll find out. Bought these for my 2017 iLX and they adjust well and stays in place without the use of the velcro included. I don't like to apply any stickers to my car because of the heat season that will cause the adhesive to melt.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl T

customer_reviews.title: Fills the gap
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fills the pesky gap between the seat and console in our Sienna (honestly, who leaves a gap big enough for stuff to fall through but not big enough for your hand to fit?). Also shallow enough to store phone, pens or other items small items but still retrieve them. The pockets have already caught a host of otherwise lost items.
customer_reviews.author: emmy

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: I had bought something similar from another vendor and it broke the same day. I was hesitant about buying another one. I took a chance and recently bought from this vendor and I love it! Saves from my phone calling between the seats.
customer_reviews.author: Rml

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, well-made, and the perfect depth: cell phones stick nicely out of the top, and anything smaller (think pens, change, tie-clips, etc...) isn’t lost to the deep. For the driver’s side, I leave mine tucked way down to catch the things that inevitable fall from my pockets. For the passenger side I leave it propped up an inch above the seat to house my phone, wallet, and so on while I’m driving. I’m a huge fan.
customer_reviews.author: Colombia C

customer_reviews.title: Car Console/Seat Gap Filler
customer_reviews.text: It's a very tight fit for my Hyundai Tucson. It won't serve as a "console organizer". I'll keep it because it will prevent anything from falling in between the center console and the front seat.
customer_reviews.author: I❤️Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Extra space
customer_reviews.text: This fit in between my front seat and console. I needed a little extra space for phones and the cup holders are used a lot already. The Gap filler holds things well and stays between the seat and console. I’ve been using it for 2 weeks. I wanted something that would hold things, not a “gap filler” for preventing stuff from falling between the seat and console. This seemed a better idea than just a filler.
customer_reviews.author: Sumit

customer_reviews.title: They seem fine.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a very short time & only driven my car once since I've had it. It seemed fine. Put my phone in the driver's side one & that worked fine. That's about all I can say at this point. I don't know if they shift, slide down further etc. I think they will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Val Todd

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job....
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised... The reason I only gave it 4 stars is that the opening is fairly narrow but I can still get my cell phone and sun glasses in. It is not a fault of the product, but the physical dimensions of my 2015 Porsche macan.... that being said I would purchase it again and do recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Thud424

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant idea
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought the gap filler was too narrow to hold anything, but it loosened up a bit with some use. It’s big enough for my phone, small notebook, pens and markers and reading glasses. No more stuff falling between the seat and console. Love this product. Glad I bought 2 - one for each side.
customer_reviews.author: Classic Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Workable - not much storage space though
customer_reviews.text: These are a real snug fit, so snug it doesn't leave much storage space. It does do what it was designed to do, and that is catch whatever slips between the seat and console. If I were buying again, I would go to Weather Tech and buy what is designed specifically for the make and model of my car.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Girl

customer_reviews.title: Subaru Crosstrek
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 2018 Subaru Crosstrek front bucket seats. Fits great between passenger seat and console without squeezing the center. However, the drivers bucket seat appears to be a bit wider because the gap squeezed the center area of the Gap Filler to almost a 1/4", causing the ends to be the only useful section. I'm going to keep only one (passenger seat) and give the other one to my daughter for her VW Jetta. All in all, the product is flawless and works as described - just not ideal for the drivers seat of my Crosstrek. Would I buy it again? Yes - but not a pair of them!
customer_reviews.author: Frances
